item.title: Respawn Entertainment’s Star Wars RTS Game Will be Revealed in April, it’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/star-wars-rts-game/

A new claim has said that Respawn Entertainment’s Star Wars RTS Game will be revealed between April 18-20.

That’s according to X (Formerly Twitter) user @bogorad222, who said that the public announcement and trailer would be released during the Star Wars Celebration in Japan, which takes place April 18-20, 2025.

While mainly known for obtaining information via LinkedIn searching, bogorad222 provided Insider Gaming with sufficient evidence that the claims were genuine from one source.

Announced in January 2022, Respawn Entertainment’s Star Wars RTS is being developed alongside Bit Reactor, led by games industry veteran Greg Foerstch. Respawn will produce the new Star Wars strategy game, while Bit Reactor will lead the development of the title. 

“We are huge fans of Star Wars here at Respawn and we’re thrilled to work with Lucasfilm Games on new titles that we have wanted to make for years,” said Zampella. “If you want to make great Star Wars games, you should come join us on our journey.” 

At the time of writing, EA has not given any other updates on the project, so at least time-wise, an update or announcement is likely to happen later this year.

In February 2024, EA canceled Respawn Entertainment’s first-person Mandalorian game, which would see players take control of a bounty hunter in a linear-level experience.

Are you looking forward to hearing more about the Star Wars RTS game? Let us know in the comments below or our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Dragon Age: The Veilguard game director leaving Bioware. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: The Thing & Human Torch Release Period in Marvel Rivals
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/the-thing-human-torch-release-dates-marvel-rivals/

Marvel Rivals is adding The Thing and the Human Torch to make its almighty roster even more super. It completes the Fantastic Four set and brings some of Marvel’s most famous and feared friends together at last.

It’s rare nowadays to see a service title do little wrong and remain popular. Marvel Rivals is doing this and is flourishing further with Season 1. The first official season brought many changes, including the addition of the Fantastic Four as new heroes.

However, only Mister Fantastic and the Invisible Woman are available. The Thing and Johnny Storm (Human Torch) are inbound, let’s get an ETA on their debut.

When Are The Thing & Human Torch Coming to Marvel Rivals?

NetEase hasn’t given a date for Thing & Human Torch’s arrival, but using logic and game director Guangyun Chen’s own words, we expect the duo to arrive on Friday, February 21.

In an interview with Metro, Guangyun Chen confirmed Marvel Rivals is getting two new heroes every three months. Season 1 is a bit different, and he was asked about the regularity of new heroes joining. He says each new season lasts three months (12 weeks), and “for each half of the season, we will introduce a new hero” which is roughly six weeks apart.

Marvel Rivals Season 1 launched on January 10. If we fast forward six weeks from this date, it takes us nicely to February 21. There is a chance their arrival might be one week later though.

According to the “Marvel Rivals Season 1 Begins Dev Vision Vol. 03” video on the official Marvel Rivals YouTube channel, Season 1’s two halves are “lasting six or seven weeks.“

Timestamp—1:36.

If it is seven weeks, The Thing and Human Torch arrive on February 28 instead. We’ll keep checking the Marvel Rivals socials closer to the time to see when NetEase is launching the heroes.

Human Torch Abilities & Leaks in Marvel Rivals

Thanks to the Marvel Rivals – Leaks & Info X page, we’ve had a sneak of the Human Torch’s upcoming abilities. The controls are for PC users, but a quick remap should make the transition to console controls simple.

The Thing Abilities & Leaks in Marvel Rivals

We also have the leaked abilities and moveset for The Thing as well—thanks to Marvel Rivals – Leaks & Info. The big, bludgeoning beast is going to be a terrorizing Tank to push teams forward.

It’s been fun using Mister Fantastic and Invisible Woman, but we’re ready for the rest of the team. Have you enjoyed using one over the other, and which of the two recruits are you most looking forward to based on what we know?

Keep up with the latest Marvel Rivals guides including how to trigger Spidey’s Spider-Tracer 10 Times, and what SVP means in Rivals.

item.title: Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s Hero of Justice DLC Features 11 Playable Characters
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dragon-ball-sparking-zeros-hero-of-justice-dlc/

Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s DLC 1, Hero of Justice, arrives on January 23, 2025, with 11 new playable characters and tons of new content. 

Bandai Namco has just released the new Dragon Ball Sparking Zero Hero of Justice DLC trailer featuring 11 new characters, one exclusive costume, three custom battles and more. The Hero of Justice DLC will cover the events of the Dragon Ball Super: Super Hero movie, where we see Gohan and Piccolo battle against the Gamma Twins and Cell. Early access for the DLC kicks off on January 21 at 00:00 CET / January 20 at 15:00 PST.

The playable characters in Dragon Ball Sparking Zero Hero of Justice DLC will feature the highly awaited transformation of Gohan, Beast Gohan, and his other forms from the Super Hero movie. Players will also receive the Orange Piccolo transformation and other Super Hero forms for the Namekian. Regarding villains, players will see Gamma 1, Gamma 2, and Cell Max join the roster. 

Moreover, Dragon Ball Sparking Zero Hero of Justice DLC will introduce three new custom battles. The first seems like a clash between the old and new Androids, the second is a battle with Cell Max, and the third is a face-off between Gohan and Goku. Players will also receive the Red Ribbon Army costume for Piccolo in this update. 

Lastly, in addition to the Dragon Ball Sparking Zero Hero of Justice DLC, the developers are adding a limited-time mode called Legendary Warrior Face-Off Mode. This mode will allow players to battle against “characters with sky-high power levels. ” The first one they have to face off against is Broly. The developers will conduct tests with this game mode to prepare for a second test.

In other news, Dragon Ball Sparking Zero is one of the best-selling games in Bandai Namco’s history. Also, the game unlocked all stages for its local co-op mode in its previous update. What are your thoughts on Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s Hero of Justice DLC? Let us know in the comments below or our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Dragon Age: The Veilguard game director leaving Bioware. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
